These idioms are often short phrases of common words so it is very difficult to look them up in a normal search engine.

Like any translator you need a solid awareness of Russian grammar to use the output properly. If I could request any new features, it would be more metadata about the gender and case of each word to help learners like me, and maybe a way to force the gender of a particular English word. Thanks for the great app!

column9: Excellent but has a few minor flaws
column10:
I use this app on a regular basis for my Russian, as well as other languages (German, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, and maybe Czech) and it's gotten most of my translations correct.

However, it sometimes bugs out and either gives me the wrong translation, wrong ending, or doesn't translate at all. I only used the camera feature once and I was not impressed, but I won't critique that as that's a fairly new feature. 

The thing I like about this translator is that it has prediction, in case you're not sure how to spell a word. I also like the fact that you can just swipe to your left to either get the previous translation or you can start a new translation by just swiping it to the right. 

The thing I like the most about this translator is that if you're learning Russian, its translations are extremely elaborate, meaning it's not just a word by word translation. It gives examples and synonyms, along with parts of speech. 

If Yandex Translator did this with every language it can translate (and get it right), I would say this is the perfect translator. Despite its flaw (as no online translator is perfect), it's still a lot better than Google Translate and the other online translators out there.
